channel.title: [C4D] Work
channel.description:
Alright, so far alls I got is some chairs. But I do plan on adding more to this thread later instead of creating new threads all the time.
The chairs were made by me just my messing around, I did not use a tutorial at all.
http://i36.tinypic.com/5tz8xx.png - Is a picture of the chairs, plain but it's my first thing and ya

you seem to know the tools pretty well.

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Well Frell, thanks for the advice and stuff.

I noticed your lamp shade, and was thinking of re-doing mine before I saw it. When I saw yours I just re-did mine, and added a table. Used an array for the chairs, and stuff.

Trying to utilize what the program has to help me out.

Any more advice?

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

the bank:

He is not spamming by saying that your program is a piece of shit, which it is.

I didn’t say that his post was spam, I told him to stop spamming, as in the entire forums, he spams a lot, and the same that goes for him goes for you. You may tell me SCAR is crap once you achieve something yourself. There’s thousands of people who use SCAR that seem to disagree with you and of course there’s the tonns of communities like this one that have a separated section for SCAR.

[quote=“Frell, post:24, topic:249606”]Not to bad once again, this so far is better than my first living room:

Maybe not model wise because its a pretty simple scene but overall it looks nice.[/quote]
When did you make that living room?

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Bryanc, post:25, topic:249606”]Yeah I couldn’t find a decent wood texture. They all charge money and that one was free.

Anyways, I used a cube lol, I was gonna use plane but was like fuck it for nao. But I am going to start working on a table or something.[/quote]
Good that your using the cube, i used to use floors

Try that for the floor, use a low, wide specular and no reflections. Also add bump. Click on the texture, go to basic and add the bump tab. Then use that picture and choose the % you want to be bumped out or in.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Yeah I couldn’t find a decent wood texture. They all charge money and that one was free.

Anyways, I used a cube lol, I was gonna use plane but was like fuck it for nao. But I am going to start working on a table or something.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Not to bad once again, this so far is better than my first living room:

Maybe not model wise because its a pretty simple scene but overall it looks nice.

Try a more realistic wood texture also.

And what are you making your walls out of?

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Lol

I deleted all those chairs, only got the one now.

Frell, I did the updates you said, changed the floor texture to something I found online and the wall texture as well. Added a reflection to the floors and I got this: http://i36.tinypic.com/2vdsp6f.jpg

What do you think. Not too shabby for me

Lol thanks for saying its not bad too.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:21, topic:249606”][quote author=Freddy1990 link=topic=328992.msg2573884#msg2573884 date=1228852202]

everyones getting into c4d

I tries C4D a few years back, but graphics is just not my thing really, once a programmer…

SCAR isn’t programming, it’s shit for retards.

You may not have noticed, but I don’t script SCAR, I code SCAR. Maybe save your crap for when you’ve achieved something yourself. And cut out the spamming and flaming.
[/quote]He is not spamming by saying that your program is a piece of shit, which it is.

But for the sake of not derailing this thread, good work but the chairs look a little too close together, how does anyone fit by?[/quote]
Anorexic assembly.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

This isn’t that bad really, you seem to understand a bit of it. When i first started i had no clue where to find shadows on the light settings

Start getting creative, color the walls and maybe change the color of the tiles to a white, and add some reflectivity.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Work
item.dc:creator: @bryanc Bryanc
item.description:
@bryanc wrote:

Alright, thanks for this shit on my thread guys. 0.0

Anyways,

Newer, light shade is more transparent, what else should I do. And you were right above chairs hovering, it somehow moved every other two chairs up… but I have no clue what I did. Sorry, I didn’t realize it, anyways any ideas on what I should attempt next/edit on this one. Or a tutorial I could use?

EDIT:

Did a little more, added a floor with the default tile texture (lame lol) and added a bump too it too. Also added two walls, and got a little further, moved the lamp to the corner, and stuff. I hopefully will make a dining table or something and add it.

Read full topic
